Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the interior is flecked with a brown resinous deposit, exterior covered with a light-brown slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393213) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393213)
